article_title: Murkowski was second to split from GOP leadership on shutdown
article_text: "I will tell you there were some outside influences that did not help this process whatsoever, some outside groups that are pretty focused on a very fringe element of the Republican Party that said you step out of line, we are going to primary you," Murkowski said. "Now I'm not quite sure when being primaried became a verb but somehow or other it has become this enormous threat out there."

article_metadata.description: Talking to reporters Friday on the campus of Alaska Pacific University before a speech at a women's summit there, Sen. Lisa Murkowski called the federal government shutdown unfortunate and unnecessary. She said it was pushed on Congress by outside groups and the tea party, which she called

Lisa Murkowski called the federal government shutdown unfortunate and unnecessary. She said it was pushed on Congress by outside groups and the tea party, which she called
og.title: Murkowski was second to split from GOP leadership on shutdown

article_summary:
"Now I'm not quite sure when being primaried became a verb but somehow or other it has become this enormous threat out there."
"I will tell you there were some outside influences that did not help this process whatsoever, some outside groups that are pretty focused on a very fringe element of the Republican Party that said you step out of line, we are going to primary you," Murkowski said.
